name: Evangeline Inn & Motel Inc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the motel several several years ago while on a solo trip, so I chose it for a layover for a road trip thru the Canadian Maritimes with my husband. I asked for, and got one of the recently remodeled rooms. The room was very clean, the TV channel selection was good (we got the Patriot's opening Monday night game!). While there were guests in rooms on either side of us, it was one of the quietest hotel/motel nights we've ever experienced. The grounds are very pretty, and the restaurant on the property appeared to do a brisk business, although we ate in Wolfville - just a couple of miles away. There is wired internet in the rooms, and they supply the ethernet cord.
reviews.title: Evangeline Motel - excellent place to lay your head

reviews.text: We were very happy with our stay, and highly recommend the place.
reviews.title: A little disappointed this time

reviews.text: We have always been happy with our food here. Today, not so much. We arrived shortly after 1 pm and they weren't busy, so we were pleased we didn't have to wait for a table. We ordered very basic things - 1 hot dog, 1 small hamburger, and 1 large hamburger with a cup of soup of the day- homemade corn chowder. And we waited....and we waited.. and we waited. Finally my hubby's chowder arrived. As he described it 'warm milk, utterly tasteless.' The rest of the meals arrived. You know you have a problem when they make sure you have a fork and knife to eat your hamburger with. The large hamburger (4 oz) was overflowing with large slices of onions, fried in butter and very greasy. The plate was greasy and you couldn't even pick up the burger. It was eaten with a fork and knife and all you could taste was onions. For the first time, we didn't stay for dessert.
reviews.title: Been here for years- for a reason

reviews.text: We will think twice about going back anytime soon.
reviews.title: Family restaurant with old time flair

reviews.text: We drive down from Halifax (about an hour's drive) a few times each summer. I started eating there while I was a student boarding with a senior at Acadia University in neighbouring Wolfville. She liked to go at least once a week. And I got hooked.
reviews.title: Big Flavor comes in small gem

reviews.text: I arrived late without a reservation, and the staff could not have been more accomodating. The room was spacious with a large bathroom, and spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable. I liked the baggie of clean old towels rags for cleaning the car, if needed. It was a very pretty quiet spot up on a hill, and a nice place to enjoy the rural quiet.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel, accomodating staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The coffee shop down the road towards the highway is open much earlier in the morning than the on-site restaurant, and I highly recommend their free-trade coffee.
reviews.title: Comfortable Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn was in a great location, as our focus of this location was the Domaine de Grand Pre winery. The Inn was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable of our trip, we had a king. My complaints are the shower curtain wasn't sufficient and we got water all over the floor, as it's a claw foot tub with shower head added and the floor was has an obvious slope to it, which made me nervous, but they are aware of it as evidenced by the block under the front feet of the beautiful wardrobe (the Inn is furnished nicely). My only other complaint was the room was so hot when we checked in because the windows had not been open, but the curtains were open and the sun heated the room. This could have been alleviated by merely keeping the blinds closed or open the windows prior to our arrival. There was no air conditioning, but there was a small fan to help us stay cool after our showers. By bed time, the room was comfortable. This was a good value and included breakfast at the diner. I wasn't clear how far the diner was, but rest assured if you are wondering, it is on the premises just across the parking lot. The Inn is also very close to the winery, you can see it and is certainly within walking distance, but we drove, because the cars fly on the road, since it is close to a major highway. We enjoyed the gas station across the street, as it was full service. I haven't seen a full service gas station in many many years! We would have preferred the other Inn in Grand Pre for our stay, but this was certainly enjoyable and again, a very comfortable night sleep on a great bed.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay in Grand Pre
Great meal and Service
reviews.text: Super food all made from scratch and the deserts ( pies ) are to die for. The service is excellent and quick . very reasonably priced.

reviews.title: nice
reviews.text: just what we wanted for a late lunch - simple, tasty food with very friendly service - the homemade pies are special - did stay in the good value motel with a wonderful view and a relaxed feel - well placed for many interesting sites as well as doing the ever-expanding wine tour

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: We were here for lunch today and the place was packed! By the time we left, they were lined up at the door, waiting for a table. Open seasonally May -October, and just down the road from the Grand Pre National HIstoric site, this little gem is clean, and with lots of homemade goodies to choose from. They do not serve french fries, which is a nice change. Daily specials, like homemade soups, tuna melts, etc are very reasonably priced. Cheerful staff makes a difference too. The lobster sandwich is sooo good. Homemade pies too! If you are looking for good, homemade food, with nice portions, this is the place. I noticed that they have 2 oz and 4 oz side hamburgers! They are also open for breakfast

reviews.title: The pies are to die for, worth the drive!
reviews.text: This is a little gem, open seasonally (May-Oct.), this place is generally on the busy side. No deep fryer (no fries), however, you barely miss them. I recommend their burgers and shakes, their club sandwich is also tasty. The pies are their specialty, and boy what a selection, please don't leave without ordering a slice (my favorite is the butterscotch). The only downside is that you can't order a whole pie to take home, I guess I'll just have to keep going......

I needed a place between Halifax and Kentville to serve as "home" for my 92 year-old mother for a week while I did research in the area. Her interest in Acadian culture and history made Grand Pre the perfect choice; and the Evangeline Motel was perfect as well. We chose the motel to be sure my mum would be able to get around okay, but having seen the Inn, the lower level rooms (2) would have been perfectly fine.
reviews.title: Home Sweet Home Away From Home!

aka: Evangeline Inn & Motel Inc. Grand Pre, Nova Scotia
